intro: Antichorus, commonly known as *Antichorus tetraphylla*, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its umbellate inflorescence. The plant has finely divided, fern-like leaves and produces small, white or greenish flowers. It is often found in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens.
